alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 3:27PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Kootenai County through 300 PM PDT... At 224 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dalton Gardens, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coeur d`Alene, Hayden, Dalton Gardens, Hayden Lake, Fourth Of July Pass, Fernan Lake Village, and Wolf Creek Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Idaho between mile markers 10 and 20, and between mile markers 22 and 30. U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 426 and 440. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. If on or near Hayden Lake and the north end of Lake Coeur d`Alene, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area
